intro: Ptilostemon gnaphaloides subsp. gnaphaloides, commonly known as the woolly everlasting, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its dense, silver-gray foliage and small, daisy-like flowers that bloom in shades of white and yellow. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its aromatic properties. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and dry landscapes. Its unique appearance and drought tolerance make it an attractive addition to native plant collections.
